info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:58AM CDT until June 17 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL MONROE AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 558 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Germantown to 6 miles south of New Memphis to 6 miles southwest of New Design, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Waterloo, New Athens, Marissa, Valmeyer, New Design, St. Libory, Lenzburg, Hecker, Fayetteville, Madonnaville, Wartburg, Burksville, Monroe City and Harrisonville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
